1"""Where helpful functions which otherwise do not belong in the library,  

2for the GUIs, exist.""" 

3 

4import os 

5 

6import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 

7 

8from PySide6 import QtCore, QtWidgets, QtGui 

9 

10import opihiexarata 

11import opihiexarata.library as library 

12import opihiexarata.library.error as error 

13import opihiexarata.library.hint as hint 

14 

15import opihiexarata.astrometry as astrometry 

16import opihiexarata.photometry as photometry 

17import opihiexarata.propagate as propagate 

18import opihiexarata.orbit as orbit 

19import opihiexarata.ephemeris as ephemeris 

20 

21 

22def apply_window_icon( 

23 window: hint.Union[hint.widget, hint.window], icon_path: str = None 

24) -> None: 

25 """This function just applies the window icon to the GUI interfaces. 

26 We break it out as a function so that it is much easier to change the 

27 window icons uniformly. 

28 

29 Parameters 

30 ---------- 

31 window : QtWidget, QtMainWindow 

32 The window which the image will be applied to. 

33 icon_path : str, default = None 

34 The path of the icon file. If None, then we default to the 

35 ``window_icon.png`` file in the qtui directory. 

36 

37 Returns 

38 ------- 

39 None 

40 """ 

41 if icon_path is not None: 

42 icon_path = os.path.abspath(icon_path) 

43 else: 

44 self_dir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__)) 

45 icon_path = library.path.merge_pathname( 

46 directory=[self_dir, "qtui"], filename="window_icon", extension="png" 

47 ) 

48 # We set the window icon. 

49 window.setWindowIcon(QtGui.QIcon(icon_path)) 

50 # All done. 

51 return None 

52 

53 

54def get_busy_image_array(progress_index: int = None) -> hint.array: 

55 """This function gets the busy image and returns it in the form of a 

56 color array which can be plot with matplotlib. The image file is stored 

57 as per convention. 

58 

59 Parameters 

60 ---------- 

61 progress_index : int, default = None 

62 If provided, and between 1-4 inclusive, the busy image with progress 

63 text is output, otherwise, the default image without any text is used. 

64 

65 Returns 

66 ------- 

67 busy_image : array 

68 The image array which is the busy image. 

69 """ 

70 # Getting the busy file image. 

71 self_dir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__)) 

72 # If a progress image is desired instead, we provide that specific path. 

73 # The progress index must be either 1-4. 

74 if progress_index == 1: 

75 busy_image_path = library.path.merge_pathname( 

76 directory=[self_dir, "qtui"], 

77 filename="busy_image_pyukumuku_1of4", 

78 extension="png", 

79 ) 

80 elif progress_index == 2: 

81 busy_image_path = library.path.merge_pathname( 

82 directory=[self_dir, "qtui"], 

83 filename="busy_image_pyukumuku_2of4", 

84 extension="png", 

85 ) 

86 elif progress_index == 3: 

87 busy_image_path = library.path.merge_pathname( 

88 directory=[self_dir, "qtui"], 

89 filename="busy_image_pyukumuku_3of4", 

90 extension="png", 

91 ) 

92 elif progress_index == 4: 

93 busy_image_path = library.path.merge_pathname( 

94 directory=[self_dir, "qtui"], 

95 filename="busy_image_pyukumuku_4of4", 

96 extension="png", 

97 ) 

98 else: 

99 # A valid progress index was not provided, we just default to the 

100 # non-progress bar version. 

101 busy_image_path = library.path.merge_pathname( 

102 directory=[self_dir, "qtui"], 

103 filename="busy_image_pyukumuku", 

104 extension="png", 

105 ) 

106 # Load in the image. 

107 busy_image = plt.imread(busy_image_path) 

108 return busy_image 

109 

110 

111def pick_engine_class_from_name( 

112 engine_name: str, engine_type: hint.ExarataEngine = library.engine.ExarataEngine 

113) -> hint.ExarataEngine: 

114 """This returns a specific engine class provided its user friendly name. 

115 This is a convince function for both development and implementation. 

116 

117 If an engine name provided is not present, this raises. This is not a 

118 matter of conversion because user friendly names are specific 

119 

120 Parameters 

121 ---------- 

122 engine_name : str 

123 The engine name, the user friendly version. It is case insensitive. 

124 engine_type : ExarataEngine 

125 The engine subtype, if not provided, then it searches through all 

126 available implemented engines. 

127 

128 Returns 

129 ------- 

130 engine_class : ExarataEngine 

131 The more specific engine class based on the engine name. 

132 """ 

133 # Making the engine entry case insensitive. 

134 engine_name = str(engine_name).casefold() 

135 

136 # Defining all of the implemented engines and their names. 

137 astrometry_engines = { 

138 "astrometry.net nova": astrometry.AstrometryNetWebAPIEngine, 

139 "astrometry.net host": astrometry.AstrometryNetHostAPIEngine, 

140 } 

141 photometry_engines = { 

142 "pan-starrs 3pi dr2 mast": photometry.PanstarrsMastWebAPIEngine, 

143 } 

144 orbit_engines = { 

145 "orbfit": orbit.OrbfitOrbitDeterminerEngine, 

146 "custom orbit": orbit.CustomOrbitEngine, 

147 } 

148 ephemeris_engines = { 

149 "jpl horizons": ephemeris.JPLHorizonsWebAPIEngine, 

150 } 

151 propagate_engines = { 

152 "linear": propagate.LinearPropagationEngine, 

153 "quadratic": propagate.QuadraticPropagationEngine, 

154 } 

155 

156 # If the user provided a specific engine type to use. 

157 if engine_type == library.engine.AstrometryEngine: 

158 engine_dict_list = [astrometry_engines] 

159 elif engine_type == library.engine.PhotometryEngine: 

160 engine_dict_list = [photometry_engines] 

161 elif engine_type == library.engine.OrbitEngine: 

162 engine_dict_list = [orbit_engines] 

163 elif engine_type == library.engine.EphemerisEngine: 

164 engine_dict_list = [ephemeris_engines] 

165 elif engine_type == library.engine.PropagationEngine: 

166 engine_dict_list = [propagate_engines] 

167 elif issubclass(engine_type, library.engine.ExarataEngine): 

168 # Just search through all of them. 

169 engine_dict_list = [ 

170 astrometry_engines, 

171 photometry_engines, 

172 orbit_engines, 

173 ephemeris_engines, 

174 propagate_engines, 

175 ] 

176 else: 

177 raise error.InputError( 

178 "The engine type provided to narrow down the search space is not a valid" 

179 " ExarataEngine." 

180 ) 

181 

182 # Searching through all of the engines to find the right one. 

183 for dictdex in engine_dict_list: 

184 for namedex, enginedex in dictdex.items(): 

185 if engine_name == namedex: 

186 return enginedex 

187 else: 

188 # Not the found name. 

189 continue 

190 

191 # If the loop did not break, then it likely means that no engine has been 

192 # found which matches the name provided. 

193 raise error.InputError( 

194 "There is no engine of the name `{n}` that matches any implemented engine of" 

195 " the `{t}` class.".format(n=engine_name, t=engine_type) 

196 ) 

197 # All done. 

198 return None
